edu.ucla.sspace.ri
Class HadoopRandomIndexing

java.lang.Object
  edu.ucla.sspace.ri.HadoopRandomIndexing

public class HadoopRandomIndexing
extends Object

An implementation of Random Indexing that uses Hadoop to perform a distributed co-occurrence counting. This class is designed to only be used on systems where a Hadoop system is currently installed and running. Furthermore, this class depends on all external resources and corpora being present in the Hadoop distributed file system.

This class supports the following properties.

Property: "edu.ucla.sspace.ri.HadoopRandomIndexing.windowSize"
Default: 2
This property sets the number of words before and after that are counted as co-occurring. With the default value, 2 words are counted before and 2 words are counter after. This class always uses a symmetric window.

Property: "edu.ucla.sspace.ri.HadoopRandomIndexing.vectorLength"
Default: 4000
This property sets the number of dimensions to be used for the index and semantic vectors.

Property: "edu.ucla.sspace.ri.HadoopRandomIndexing.usePermutations"
Default: false
This property specifies whether to enable permuting the index vectors of co-occurring words. Enabling this option will cause the word semantics to include word-ordering information. However this option is best used with a larger corpus.

Property: "edu.ucla.sspace.ri.HadoopRandomIndexing.permutationFunction"
Default: DefaultPermutationFunction
This property specifies the fully qualified class name of a PermutationFunction instance that will be used to permute index vectors. If the "edu.ucla.sspace.ri.HadoopRandomIndexing.usePermutations" is set to false, the value of this property has no effect.

Property: "edu.ucla.sspace.ri.HadoopRandomIndexing.sparseSemantics"
Default: true
This property specifies whether to use a sparse encoding for each word's semantics. Using a sparse encoding can result in a large saving in memory, while requiring more time to process each document.

See Also:
RandomIndexing, WordCooccurrenceCountingJob

Method Detail

execute

public void execute(Collection<String> inputDirs,
                    SemanticSpaceWriter writer)
             throws Exception
Computes the co-occurrences present in the documents in the input directory and writes the SemanticSpace to the provided writer.

Parameters:
inputDirs - one or more a directories in the Hadoop file system that contain all the documents to process
writer - a writer to which the output SemanticSpace will be written upon completion of the map-reduce analysis.
Throws:
Exception - if any exception occurs during the Hadoop processing or when writing the SemanticSpace

getWordToIndexVector

public Map<String,TernaryVector> getWordToIndexVector()
Returns an unmodifiable view on the token to IntegerVector mapping used by this instance. Any further changes made by this instance to its token to IntegerVector mapping will be reflected in the returned map.

Returns:
a mapping from the current set of tokens to the index vector used to represent them

setWordToIndexVector

public void setWordToIndexVector(Map<String,TernaryVector> m)
Assigns the token to IntegerVector mapping to be used by this instance. The contents of the map are copied, so any additions of new index words by this instance will not be reflected in the parameter's mapping.

Parameters:
m - a mapping from token to the IntegerVector that should be used represent it when calculating other word's semantics
